question_stem.en: A 64-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to left lower extremity weakness. The patient was asymptomatic when he went to bed the night before, but he has had difficulty standing after waking up today. He has had no headache, double vision, or back pain. Medical history is significant for hypertension, diabetes mellitus, and myocardial infarction. Temperature is 37 C (98.6 F), blood pressure is 140/90 mm Hg, and pulse is 110/min and irregularly irregular. Left lower extremity examination shows motor power is 0/5, deep tendon reflexes are 3+, and Babinski sign is present. Right lower extremity examination is normal. An abnormality in which of the following structures is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms? {{exhibit_1}}
question_stem.zh: 一名64岁男性因左下肢无力就诊于急诊科。患者前一天晚上睡觉时无症状，但今天醒来后站立困难。他没有头痛、复视或背痛。病史提示高血压、糖尿病和心肌梗死。体温37°C（98.6°F），血压140/90 mmHg，脉搏110次/分，不规则。左下肢检查显示肌力0/5级，深腱反射3+，Babinski征阳性。右下肢检查正常。以下哪种结构的异常最有可能导致该患者的症状？{{exhibit_1}}

question.en: An abnormality in which of the following structures is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?
question.zh: 以下哪种结构的异常最有可能导致该患者的症状？

A.en: Anterior spinal artery of the lumbosacral region

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of stroke syndromes, specifically anterior cerebral artery (ACA) stroke, and its characteristic presentation of contralateral lower extremity weakness. It also requires understanding of the common etiology of ACA stroke, which is cardioembolic due to atrial fibrillation.

To solve this question, identify the key findings of isolated lower extremity weakness and irregular heart rhythm (atrial fibrillation). Recognize that ACA stroke is the most likely cause of isolated lower extremity weakness, and atrial fibrillation is a common risk factor for cardioembolic stroke.
summary.zh:
本题考察对卒中综合征的了解，特别是大脑前动脉（ACA）卒中，及其对侧下肢无力的特征性表现。它还需要理解大脑前动脉卒中的常见病因，即由于房颤引起的血栓栓塞。

要解决此问题，请确定孤立性下肢无力和心律不齐（房颤）的关键发现。认识到大脑前动脉卒中是孤立性下肢无力的最可能原因，而房颤是血栓栓塞性卒中的常见危险因素。

tags: Stroke; Anterior cerebral artery; Atrial fibrillation; Cardioembolic stroke; Lower extremity weakness; Neurology; Cerebrovascular disease
